description: Guide for points-based skilled migration (Subclass 189/190) and employer-sponsored routes (Subclass 482 / Skills in Demand).

meta.passport_validity: Valid for travel and ideally >6 months on date of lodgement
meta.min_funds_requirement: **Sponsored (482/Employer):** Salary must meet the TSMIT (AUD 76,515). **Skilled (189/190):** No fixed balance but recommend AUD 30k–40k for initial settlement proof.

documents.title: Positive Skills Assessment
documents.description: Required for points streams (189/190). Obtain from the correct assessing authority (e.g., ACS for ICT, VETASSESS for many trades/professions, EA for engineers).

documents.title: English Test Results (IELTS/PTE/TOEFL)
documents.description: Needed to claim points (189/190) and as evidence for visa lodgement. Higher scores = more points.

documents.title: Expression of Interest (EOI) — SkillSelect
documents.description: Mandatory step for 189/190: create an EOI in SkillSelect and claim your points (age, English, qualifications, experience).

documents.title: Employer Nomination / TRN (482)
documents.description: Employer must lodge sponsorship and nomination; employee receives a TRN (Transaction Reference Number) needed to lodge the visa application.

documents.title: Police Clearance Certificate (PCC)
documents.description: PCC from Passport Office (PSK) / local police as required; must match skills/experience claims and be recent per Home Affairs guidance.

documents.title: Employment Reference Letters & Payslips
documents.description: Detailed reference letters on company letterhead specifying role, duties, FTE, start/end dates + payslips and tax documents to support claims.

documents.title: Health & Medical Checks (HAP ID)
documents.description: Book panel physician via eMedical after lodgement request; chest X-ray and health checks may be required.

steps_flow.title: Choose Track: Points (189/190) vs Employer-Sponsored (482)
steps_flow.description: Decide whether you will apply via SkillSelect points (189/190) or through an employer nomination (482/Skills in Demand). If employer route, ensure they are willing to sponsor and meet TSMIT.

steps_flow.title: Skills Assessment (If applying points or required by occupation)
steps_flow.description: Apply to the relevant assessing authority (ACS/VETASSESS/EA etc.). Processing times vary (4–12 weeks). You need a Positive assessment letter to claim points or substantiate the visa application.

steps_flow.title: Lodge EOI in SkillSelect (189/190) OR Employer lodges Nomination (482)
steps_flow.description: 189/190: Create EOI in SkillSelect and claim your points; wait for Invitation to Apply (ITA). 482: Employer lodges sponsorship and nomination; ensure offered salary ≥ TSMIT.

steps_flow.title: Prepare & Apostille Documents (If required)
steps_flow.description: Legalise Indian documents where required (PCC, degrees) via MEA apostille/e-Sanad, translate to English if necessary, and gather originals/copies.

steps_flow.title: Lodge Visa Application in ImmiAccount
steps_flow.description: Once invited (189/190) or nominated (482), lodge your visa in ImmiAccount, attach all supporting docs, pay fees, and follow any requests for further information.

steps_flow.title: Medicals, Biometrics & Await Decision
steps_flow.description: Complete medicals (HAP ID) and biometrics when requested. Processing timelines vary; respond promptly to additional requests to avoid delays.

steps_flow.title: Visa Outcome & Arrival
steps_flow.description: On grant, receive visa grant notice (and visa label if applicable). Employer-sponsored visa holders check work start and visa conditions; permanent visas (189/190) grant residency rights.

eligibility.required_education: Relevant qualification (as per assessing authority) for nominated occupation
eligibility.required_employment_status: For 482: binding job offer + employer nomination; For 189/190: meet points threshold and invited
eligibility.max_age: Preferably under 45 for points claim (age points reduce after 45)
